signals.headline: CPS Energy issues RFP for 600 MW new solar capacity via PPAs
signals.summary: Request for proposals to acquire 600 MW solar capacity through PPAs for San Antonio service area in ERCOT. Proposals due by January 8, 2026.

signals.headline: Austin Energy issues RFP for long-term purchase of energy, capacity, and environmental attributes
signals.summary: Solicitation for capacity, energy, and attributes from ERCOT-interconnected resources compliant with ERCOT standards. Includes QSE obligations and market settlement; PDF details Nov 2025 RFP.

signals.headline: South Texas Electric Cooperative seeks long-term dispatchable generation capacity RFP
signals.summary: RFP for up to 500 MW dispatchable capacity and energy in ERCOT, considering purchases or PPAs starting 2027-2028. RFP details at STECFIRMRFP2025.com; bids due September 2025.

signals.headline: South Texas Electric Cooperative issues RFP for up to 500 MW dispatchable capacity and energy by 2028
signals.summary: Seeking 500 MW firm dispatchable capacity and energy via acquisition or 20-30 year PPAs in ERCOT, operational by Dec 1, 2028. Notice of Intent due Aug 6, 2025; bids due Sep 10, 2025.

signals.headline: Planned 5,800-acre data center and energy campus project announced for Texas Panhandle
signals.summary: A 5,800-acre project in the Texas Panhandle will include the world's largest energy campus alongside data center infrastructure. The massive acreage and integrated energy campus designation indicate extraordinary energy demands and represent a major industrial expansion opportunity.

signals.headline: Construction begins on $500 billion data center project on outskirts of Abilene, Texas
signals.summary: A $500 billion data center project under construction near Abilene represents one of the largest infrastructure investments in the state. The massive capital investment and data center classification indicate extreme energy intensity and substantial power infrastructure requirements.

signals.headline: Largest proposed data center in the U.S. approved in Pecos County, Texas
signals.summary: The largest proposed data center in the U.S. was recently approved in Pecos County, representing an unprecedented scale of data center infrastructure. This facility will have extreme energy demands for computational processing and cooling, creating major energy procurement opportunities.

signals.headline: Eneus Energy develops RGV Data Center Project near Harlingen with projected $14 billion capital investment
signals.summary: The RGV Data Center Project represents a major data center expansion with $14 billion in projected capital investment in Cameron County. Data centers are among the most energy-intensive facilities, requiring continuous power for servers and cooling systems, creating significant procurement opportunities.

signals.headline: CyrusOne develops 400 megawatt data center facility in Bosque County along the Brazos River
signals.summary: CyrusOne's 400 megawatt data center in Bosque County is a hyperscale facility with extreme energy requirements. The explicit megawatt capacity specification indicates substantial power infrastructure needs and represents a major energy-intensive industrial expansion.

signals.headline: Infrakey partners with Lacy Lakeview on proposed $10 billion data center development across 520 acres
signals.summary: This large-scale data center project represents one of the most energy-intensive facility types, with massive computational loads requiring continuous power supply and cooling infrastructure. The 520-acre footprint indicates substantial facility scale and corresponding energy demand.

signals.headline: Siemens Energy expands Houston manufacturing and engineering facilities with $1 billion U.S. investment
signals.summary: Siemens Energy is expanding its Houston presence with upgrades to manufacturing facilities for compression equipment and expanded engineering services operations. Manufacturing and service facilities for industrial equipment represent significant energy consumers requiring reliable power infrastructure.

signals.headline: Samsung receives $250 million grant to expand semiconductor manufacturing plant in Taylor, TX
signals.summary: Samsung's plant expansion in Taylor will generate over $4.73 billion in capital investments and represents a major semiconductor manufacturing facility expansion. Semiconductor fabrication plants are among the most energy-intensive industrial facilities, requiring significant power for cleanroom operations, process equipment, and climate control systems.

signals.headline: ERCOT RFP for On-site Public Speaking Training closes Feb 27, 2026
signals.summary: Procurement for consulting services RFP issued Feb 12, 2026, related to ERCOT operations.

signals.headline: PUCT Outside ERCOT Grant Program applications accepted from May 28, 2025
signals.summary: Grants for utilities/co-ops/MOUs/river authorities with infrastructure outside ERCOT. First projects advanced Aug 21, 2025.

signals.headline: PUCT Completion Bonus Grant Program for 100+ MW dispatchable ERCOT projects
signals.summary: Grants for new dispatchable generation interconnecting to ERCOT before Jun 1, 2029, meeting post-Jun 1, 2023 planning requirements.

signals.headline: PUCT In-ERCOT Generation Loan Program open for dispatchable projects adding 100+ MW
signals.summary: Low-interest loans for new/expanded dispatchable generation in ERCOT. Applications closed Jul 27, 2024; first loans signed Jun 25, 2025; disbursements by Dec 31, 2025.

signals.headline: STEC RFP targets dispatchable generation or long-term contracts in ERCOT region
signals.summary: Open to all dispatchable technologies/fuels located in ERCOT, preferably near member territories. Proposals for operational facilities, development, or PPAs starting Jun 1, 2027 to Dec 1, 2028.

signals.headline: South Texas Electric Cooperative issues RFP for up to 500 MW dispatchable capacity by 2028
signals.summary: STEC seeks 500 MW firm dispatchable capacity and energy via facility acquisition or 20-30 year PPAs/tolling agreements in ERCOT, COD no later than Dec 1, 2028. NOI deadline Aug 6, 2025; bids due Sep 10, 2025.

signals.headline: JPMorgan Chase announces new Fort Worth office to double employee capacity by 2027.
signals.summary: Large office expansion for financial operations will increase cooling, IT servers, and general facility power loads, creating institutional energy procurement opportunities.

signals.headline: Samsung receives $250 million grant to expand semiconductor plant in Taylor, TX with $4.73 billion investment.
signals.summary: Semiconductor manufacturing expansion involves energy-intensive fabrication processes like cleanrooms and etching, offering high power demand and procurement potential.
